commitResults.messageTitle: Changed any mentions of Duke to Owen
Updated error handling for deadline and event to be more stringent
Update error handling for mark, unmark and delete to cover wider range of errors
Updated semi automated testing to check for new error handling
added separators to text for neatness

commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot has no ability to retain previously written tasks by
the user.

It would enhance the functionality of the chatbot to be able to
remember tasks so it needs to be able to load data.

Let's:
Use a text file to load Todo, Deadline, and Event items when the
chatbot starts, with the use of the java.nio.file library.
Ensure the chatbot creates a data folder and an empty text file
if they do not exist on startup.

If the chatbot is able to load data from a text file, we can alter
this text file to include user data.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add convertToDataFormat function to Task and its children
commitResults.messageBody:
We have no convenient way of producing the required data format for
a Task class and its children.

We need a function to streamline the process of getting the string
to be written to text file.

Let's include the function in Task and use polymorphism to create
the child's own convertToDataFormat function

Using polymorphism reduces the amount of checks needed for what
format should be used depending on the class.

There are common fields in the data between Task and its children
so polymorphism is suitable to be used.

we have no functions to modify the data in the text file.

we need a way to save the user's changes to the tasklist to
complement the load tasklist functionality.

Lets,
*create a appendToTasklist function that append a new line of data
to the text file.
*create an overwriteTasklist function that loop through the tasklist
arraylist to overwrite the text file data by writing to it line by
line.

We use appendToTasklist when adding a new Task to the Text for
efficiency (since it directly adds to the list) while overwrite
is only used for modifying existing data (e.g. mark and delete).
